sentences: Ta ei pea õpetustest, õpetajatest midagi.
context: The Estonian word 'hooli' appears to be a variation or misspelling of the word 'miski'. Based on the dictionary definitions provided, 'miski' is an indefinite pronoun meaning 'something' or 'anything'. It's used to refer to an unspecified item, thing, or matter. The word can be used in affirmative sentences (meaning 'some/something'), negative sentences (meaning 'nothing/not any'), and as an adjective (meaning 'some kind of'). There are also fixed expressions containing this word.
